Hi Erik,
WARC is an ISO standard, so storing WARC files should be a pretty =
easy

--> yes I am agreed with you, we unpack WARC Files for some reasons b=
ut we use the original WARC Files again. 

to a) Unpacking WARC files cause=
s a loss of information (e.g. HTTP
requests, HTTP response headers, WARC me=
tadata, etc.) WARC files
are not simply a collection of files, but contain =
detailed
information about a web crawl. --> I would like to unpacking WARC =
files because I want to generate technical metadata with JHOVE of all inclu=
ded files in METS later as a UOF
 
 b) URIs do not map cleanly to file name=
s, so you will be constantly
   trying to work around this issue. 
-> I nee=
d the URIs because :
Simply packing the entire root directory into one UOF =
file is impractical because of the size of the resulting mets.xml file(from=
 the Whole WARC). Handling each bitstream as a separate UOF file will resul=
t in a lack of expressiveness with regards to structure in between individu=
al resources. A feasible approach could be the specification of a common ba=
se. (e.g. /http://www.example.com/1000/). When converting these UOF files b=
ack to WARC, this common base will have to be reattached. therefore I need =
a base URL


I hope you understand now my intention.
so, my question was wh=
en I unpack the Whole WARC-Files, I want to obtain the content in a directo=
ry. 

content means for me example  jpg, pdf, html, etc..

so how can I ext=
ract the content from each ?
